metadata.synopsis: Blue (Peter Coyote) and Eli (Nick Mancuso) are buddies living in a bohemian subculture of Los Angeles. Blue is an artist waiting for recognition, while Eli is a businessman waiting for his father to bequeath him the family lingerie factory. They are both looking for love, sex or some combination thereof, and engage meanwhile in friendly competition with one another. When Liliane (Carole Laure) arrives on the scene, their friendship is severely tested and they must decide what is truly important.

reviews: How interesting is childishness in grown men? Less than Bobby Roth thinks. Yet Roth brings a natural filmmaker's intensity to the material. When I play this movie over in my head, I laugh at it, but I'm still enjoying it, too.
A perceptive buddy film about thirtysomethings learning they are no longer boys and have to face the pitfalls of growing up.
The people in this movie might seem glamorous if you glimpsed just a small corner of their lives. But Heartbreakers sees them whole, and mercilessly.
